page.title: 02The Battle Of Huntingdon
page.content: The class and I visited the town trail where the Battle of Huntingdon took place. All the Parliamentarians were waiting at the River Ouse Bridge for the cavaliers to attack, but the only problem was the cavaliers attacked from the opposite side from ST Andrews Bridge. (Near Hodsons chip shop.) There might have been a soldier on lookout who warned the ironsides so the ironsides had to gather up their weapons and march through the deserted High Street to St Andrews Bridge . After fighting at St Andrews Bridge (Near Hodsons chip shop) the ironside retreated to (ST Johns graveyard) Fierce fighting went on for about an hour. After the fighting at ST Johns church, ST Johns was filled with smoke, flames and bodies. (ST Johns graveyard ) The Cavaliesrs won.
